name: corbel-composer
description: An example collection for corbel-composer usage

requests.name: Login client
requests.description:
Request an accessToken with a JWT assertion

1. In order to generate the JWT assertion, use this [online tool](http://jwt.io/)
    
    1. Introduce this Header for first field in `decoded`
    
            {
                "typ": "JWT",
                "alg": "HS256"
            }
    
    2. Introduce this Payload for second field in `decoded`
    
       * Expires = [epoch-time](http://www.epochconverter.com/) + 3600 (1hour)
            
                {
                    "iss": "CLIENT_ID",
                    "aud": "http://iam.bqws.io",
                    "exp": EXPIRES,
                    "scope": "client-scopes"
                }
    
    3. Introduce your secret for third field in `decoded` - see [confluence](https://confluence.bq.com/display/APPSEBOOKS/CompoSR)
    4. Copy updated `JWT_ASSERTION`
    
2. Paste `JWT_ASSERTION` value into body raw JSON
3. Send request
4. Save `data.accessToken` for next requests

requests.name: Refresh token
requests.description:
Request an accessToken with a JWT assertion

1. In order to generate the JWT assertion, use this [online tool](http://jwt.io/)
    
    1. Introduce this Header for first field in `decoded`
    
            {
                "typ": "JWT",
                "alg": "HS256"
            }
    
    2. Introduce this Payload for second field in `decoded`
    
       * Expires = [epoch-time](http://www.epochconverter.com/) + 3600 (1hour)
            
                {
                    "iss": "CLIENT_ID",
                    "aud": "http://iam.bqws.io",
                    "refresh_token": "REFRESH_TOKEN",
                    "exp": EXPIRES,
                    "scope": "user-scopes"
                }
    
    3. Introduce your secret for third field in `decoded` - see [confluence](https://confluence.bq.com/display/APPSEBOOKS/CompoSR)
    4. Copy updated `JWT_ASSERTION`
    
2. Paste `JWT_ASSERTION` value into body raw JSON
3. Send request
4. Save `data.accessToken` for next requests

requests.name: Domain phrases documentation
requests.description: Retrieves all created domain phrases as HTML

requests.name: Login user
requests.description:
Request an accessToken with a JWT assertion

1. In order to generate the JWT assertion, use this [online tool](http://jwt.io/)
    
    1. Introduce this Header for first field in `decoded`
    
            {
                "typ": "JWT",
                "alg": "HS256"
            }
    
    2. Introduce this Payload for second field in `decoded`
    
       * Expires = [epoch-time](http://www.epochconverter.com/) + 3600 (1hour)
            
                {
                    "iss": "CLIENT_ID",
                    "aud": "http://iam.bqws.io",
                    "basic_auth.username": "USERNAME",
                    "basic_auth.password": "PASSWORD",
                    "exp": EXPIRES,
                    "scope": "user-scopes"
                }
    
    3. Introduce your secret for third field in `decoded` - see [confluence](https://confluence.bq.com/display/APPSEBOOKS/CompoSR)
    4. Copy updated `JWT_ASSERTION`
    
2. Paste `JWT_ASSERTION` value into body raw JSON
3. Send request
4. Save `data.accessToken` for next requests
